text: my first stop was the hospital in the
town of I Dre I was filled with a
revulsion at the sight of children who
had been attacked by the Janjaweed and
one bed was an 11 year old boy
Abdullah Ibaka who'd been shot in the
foot in the same room was a buckaroo
Jakob who was a seventeen and had one
bullet in the stomach and another in his
leg he was a 13 year old girl fatima who
along with her sister had been shot when
she went to get firewood then there was
a six year old boy
Khalid who'd been hurt in the foot in
two places but in some ways the people
who make it to the hospital are the
lucky ones because they can get
reasonable medical care and at least
once they reach a Dre they are out of
harm's way
I left aa Dre wanting to find the kinds
of places that the victims in the
hospital beds had come from so I drove
south along the border through village
after village in the town of karma doto
I met Haroon Ismael who agreed to take
me back to the place where his family
had been attacked just 13 days earlier
his wife was running away clutching
their infant baby off med in her arms
when the Janjaweed overtook them the
Janjaweed began beating her and left her
unconscious and then they picked up
Achmed and checked and saw that he was a
boy and threw him to the ground and shot
him in the chest so he said I can't do
dangerous I'll see we were not it's very
dangerous now for us I think we stopped
here to talk so he said they saw us now
I from the trees
you think the Gentiles he asked ya the
same answer from the trees and maybe we
could go yah yah wah so we should go
back
right up to you one of the most
successful tools to the Janjaweed has
used to terrorize people and drive them
away is by widespread rate these two
girls fight Madame who's 15 is on the
left and harita gamar is 20 has on the
right described being raped by six men
and military uniforms just three days
earlier they had gone down to gather
vegetables and fruits when the Janjaweed
attacked them the Janjaweed used racial
epithets about their dark skin and beat
them with a gun they're just a few of
the rape victims that you find
everywhere all across Darfur and now and
Chad itself one of these young women
said something that really haunted me
she said that these are the things they
used to do in Darfur and now they're
doing them to us the Chadian government
is in a terrible situation because it
doesn't have enough troops to protect
the border areas in the town of iday the
local governor spoke with us about his
frustration he talked about how the
Janjaweed use humans as targets how they
kill a person as if he were a chicken
but he said that he did not have enough
soldiers to go and protect these
villages beyond i-day the situation
becomes even more desperate and
dangerous
